website_summaries.verdict: These are an impressive set of earplugs that naturally lower the volume of music while remaining comfortable, even for extended wear.
pros: Available in different colors and sizes
These plugs do an impressive job naturally lowering the volume at a concert to a comfortable listening level
Comes with convenient carrying case for earplugs
Fit well in wide variety of ear sizes
cons: Plastic handles on plugs are a bit long and may stick noticeably out of ears

customer_reviews.title: I am an Audiologist and I recommend these for everyone at concerts!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a Pearl Jam show I went to and have been wearing them every since. Used to wear normal plugs to concerts and loud bars, but often distorted the low frequencies and music never sounded great. These make everything sound NATURAL and just lower the volume. I am an audiologist and work with hearing impaired patients every day. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Product is excellent, reseller was terrible.
customer_reviews.text: The plugs are great - they do the job. That said, I ordered the regular size because it says most people will need those and because I generally use the middle sized fittings for earbuds. I found, however that the regular size were not a snug fit at all and would move around. The seller I used (not Etymotic) on Amazon would not even address my question but I went straight to Etymotic and they sent me a pair of the larger sized ones immediately. Free. That's a company that stands behind their product! I would definely buy these again but would go directly to Etymotic to do so and avoid these resellers who may not care.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cid

customer_reviews.title: Kills the high tones, ruins immersion
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed in these. After reading a bunch about how earplugs are necessary for concert-going if you want to save your hearing, and how these headphone in particular just "turn down the volume" without distorting the sound, I was pretty excited to try these out at a Red Rocks show. But they totally took me out of the experience. Rather than turning down the volume everywhere, it only did so well in the low-mid ranges. Sure I could still hear people talking, but all the high tones from the show were completely muffled out and the sound of the music was completely changed. Add in that you can't return these, and I would steer far clear of getting these earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these I purchased quite some time ago. I love them. I bough my another pair so I can spread them out a little and have them available wherever I am (leave them in car, motorcycle, toolbox, etc) This new pair is not soft silicone like the previous ones. It is very hard. They aren’t comfortable at all. I’ll stick with the old.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Can't help the quality of music (recently saw Jayden Smith ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't help the quality of music (recently saw Jayden Smith screaming into a microphone when his babysitter must have fallen asleep at a concert), but absolutely carry the quality of the sound through without making your ears bleed. I take these with me to every concert my girlfriend asks me to go to; sometimes she wears hers as well, but her ears aren't as sensitive to loud noises after years of not using protection. Trust me, kids, no one wants to be the person everything has to be repeated for. These are worth your time. :P
customer_reviews.author: OneLunchMan

customer_reviews.title: Dampens sound too much. Might as well use regular ...
customer_reviews.text: Dampens sound too much. Might as well use regular earplugs. The entire concept of having filters and holes in earplugs is a deceptive gimmick. I’ve tried several brands of “concert ear buds” , they’re all the same, and dampen the sound way too much.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Effective for concerts
customer_reviews.text: Part of my job involves interviewing the sound crew at concerts and festivals. My wife often tags along as my photographer for these gigs. We purchased these to get through a few big shows where we would be in and out of the stage area during the performances. They worked very well. I could still hear the system and maintain a conversation. It didn't just sound like I shoved in earplugs. The audible spectrum seemed to be reduced fairly evenly as the listing claimed. Very satisfied with these. They are also holding up well and should get us through at least one more season.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Matlock

customer_reviews.title: Only rated at 12db, not adequate protection
customer_reviews.text: I go to EDM shows pretty much every weekend and I’ve been using cheap foam earplugs for years. I decided it was time to upgrade to something reusable and these looked good. When I received them and saw the NRR I was very disappointed. The description said “about 20db”, but the packaging clearly says 12db. I used them once and they absolutely suck compared to the foam plugs I’ve been using (rated at 26db). I’ll be ordering another package of foam plugs. There’s no way I’m going to continue to use something that doesn’t protect my hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I hear you.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these ear plugs to replace my company issued all purpose plugs. With my hearing loss the all purpose plugs make voices harder to discern in person and over radio communications. They are overkill for the noise level we encounter on a daily basis. These Etymotic plugs do a great job of protecting my hearing and allows me to better understand verbal communication. I am a shift worker in an industrial environment so I am continually having to install and remove my ear plugs during the twelve hour shifts. The plugs have held up great and I am ordering a second backup pair today.
customer_reviews.author: WAYNETTE HOLLIS

customer_reviews.title: Totally ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for Lynyrd Skynyrd concert. Were totally ineffective. Stopped very little noise and caused so much distortion that they were unusable. I would not buy these again and will try normal jobsite earplugs next time.
customer_reviews.author: D-Jake

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for all musicians
customer_reviews.text: I use these at least twice a week while playing bass with a band, for practice and final performance. They work perfectly to help protect my hearing and bring the sound (aka the guitars) down to a reasonable level. As a result, I can hear everything better. They pop in to my ears easily, and stay put once the are in there. I don't recall ever having them come loose or falling out in several months of using them. My only complaint is that the stems stick out further than I expected. I thought that the clear plastic would be nearly invisible, but it's not. If/when these wear out, I will get the ones with short stems.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound fidelity, sufficient noise suppression
customer_reviews.text: Noise level...4. It doesnt ask about sound quality...10. I was a musician for many years and I used Hearos a lot. These are exactly like them. They aren't going to drown out a jet engine, but they really cut the edge off at a concert. But more importantly, the lows, mids and highs come through in proper proportions. I bought them for me and my son for a very loud edm concert and they were perfect. Yeah, it was still loud but not unpleasantly so. The sound quality was perfect. They stay put like they should. The little case is nice. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: plasteredkat

customer_reviews.title: Saved my ears at EDC Las Vegas
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for EDC and they were so helpful. The music there is super loud (of course) and I didnt realize how big of a difference these made in being able to survive the whole night without your ears screaming at the end. I will mention however that these make it difficult for you to hear anyone around you. I had these on and people had to tap me on the shoulder or I missed some interactions because I couldnt hear them. So now I only use them if I am 100% focused on the music and not talking to anyone around me haha.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed. As a musician, it deadens the super high and low frequencies without distorting the music. This way I can save my ears and be on pitch at the same time. I can wear them for a full 3 hour gig and they don't hurt. I acually bought two more pairs: one for the gig bag, one for the guitar case and a home pair for concerts!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for concerts
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these for 8 concerts and they’re still holding up well! I go to a lot of heavy metal shows and I love that these ear plugs don’t dampen the sounds, it just makes the music a more comfortable volume. I have chronic tinnitus (not from noise-induced hearing loss) and I’ve found that it isn’t really worsened after a concert while using these. They’re stiff, so they’re a TAD uncomfortable after using them a few hours, but I’m okay with that. Loud music hurts my ears more than the average person, so I’m actually able to enjoy concerts with these. Overall, I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: When you need it a little quieter...
customer_reviews.text: I work around a lot of people, and there's always music playing. These little guys are a savior when it comes to maintaining sanity. You're definitely still able to hear people talking, but everything is just a little quieter when you need to concentrate. I've tried these at the shooting range, and I definitely prefer my over-the-ear protection in that environment. Highly recommended, and if I lost them or broke them, there's no question I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for concerts
customer_reviews.text: Never had an issue with these. I finally cracked one (my own fault) and needed to replace them. I tried to cheap out and try some other brands, but ended up regretting it and buying these again. The stem is just long enough for handling, and a little twist helps get them gently farther in or out for the perfect level of protection for whatever you're doing. I use them at every concert, mowing, and using power tools.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Todd

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put in and work well. I have others that cost 2-3 times as much but these are still my favs. The hard stem makes it easy to insert and remove, and the noise level is dropped just enough without being too attenuated. The the tiered design also makes them almost adjustable, in that you can insert them further or less for different levels of attenuation. My other plugs don't do that very well.
customer_reviews.author: brettwestgrovemusic

customer_reviews.title: No cord, but excellent brand
customer_reviews.text: Etymotics are a great brand- for the price I think they are the best. You can hear everything you need to, but they cut out the damaging Loud. Ear health is important! Sure you can get custom fitted ones but those cost like two hundred dollars. And I loose my earplugs like crazy, so this is a good option. The only thing I don’t like about these is, they don’t come with a string that you can wear around your neck. It’s fine, I’ll just crazy glue a cord on, but yeah I’m going to lose them if I don’t have that string! My last pair of this brand had a cord, that’s why I was surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Sound great! Do very little db attenuation though
customer_reviews.text: Clearest plugs I’ve ever owned however they block the least actual DB of any... which I guess is why they sound so good. Says 15db attenuation, sounds like less to me. I bought up a dozen different brands and tried them all. These are the best. I was used to pulling them out half way through the first song of band rehearsal but I can leave these in and hear and FEEL the whole practice now. Great plugs!!!!!! Keychain is still on my keys 12 months later too! Great little pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Great for dental professionals
customer_reviews.text: I’m a dentist and I researched a couple of different earplugs to reduce the long term damage the sounds of the dental drill and suction will have on my hearing. This brand has the most affordable ear plugs. I’ve been using them for a few weeks now and it works great! Definitely dampens the high frequency noise but also muffles any conversations I’m trying to have. I remove them after procedures so I can talk to my patients
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Etesse, DDS

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice/live shows
customer_reviews.text: These help cut sound to a tolerable level and not mess too much with sound clarity. You can adjust them by pushing them in farther or our a bit more to allow more noise level through. Got them because I rehearse with an already loud band in a 12x12 foot box with reflective surfaces everywhere. They out preformed the standard foam plugs and my over the ear Vic Firth style sound dampeners. Also bring them to shows where I'm not sure how loud the artist will be, always great to have around and they're comfortable to wear for a long time with out much fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great investment to keep your hearing
customer_reviews.text: Great at lowering the volume but still keeping the sound quality. I honestly think the quality is better with these in, I don’t know how I went to shows before. The best part is you’re still able to talk to people without having to take them out. Unfortunately I lost one while at a show when my friend went to hug me and knocked it out. But I’ll definitely be buying these again when another show is coming around.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for protecting your ears!
customer_reviews.text: Wore at an awesome rock festival. Worked very well at preventing the music from damaging my ears. A bit uncomfortable to wear for like 8 hours straight, but I think that can't be avoided for long usage periods of earbuds. Also keep in mind these only really reduce volume of very loud things. Normal talking and such will sound exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jarod

customer_reviews.title: Good earplugs, but don’t block enough dB for rock concerts.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice earplugs, they’re comfy and they do maintain sound clarity at average decibels. However, I took them to a rock concert where I was fairly close to the stage, and the decibel levels were consistently in the 90- 100 dB range. In that situation, these earplugs didn’t help me at all - they didn’t block enough sound. I had to switch to foam earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey H.

customer_reviews.title: Reduces sound in office but allows me to still hear reasonably
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ear plugs for use in a noisy office. I struggle with having to deal with sudden and loud sounds which cause me a great deal of distress. I was sort of hoping for more noise dampening than these provide but what they do is adequate. It doesn't cut out all sound but it takes it down a few decibels and makes boisterous coworkers bearable. I cant wear them for too long though as eventually they tend to hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!!! Lifesavers!
customer_reviews.text: I sing on VERY loud stages (because of speakers being to close or of blasting bass & electric guitars monitors = all varieties of frequencies, from high to low ends). It was painful. I had to stop attending to some meetings because I didn't want to ruin my ears. These earplugs allow me to BE in the room (or on stage) without any pain, but also to HEAR the harmonies (or people talking), and SING my parts correctly. On top of that, thanks to their threefold shape, when I want to hear the house or when the music gets softer, I can pull them slightly out to block a little less sound but still have my ears protected.
customer_reviews.author: Maggy Doyle

customer_reviews.title: comfortable ear protection
customer_reviews.text: I work at multiple music venues, which means I'm typically at 3-6 concerts a week. These earplugs allow me to hear the music relatively well while protecting my ears. The sound quality isn't perfect, but it's clear enough to hear everything going on, even someone talking to me. They are also comfortable enough to wear for a few hours straight. The only downside is the key chain on the pouch. I kept the pouch on my keys, which I clip to a belt loop, for easy access. The chain recently broke, and I thought I lost the pouch and earplugs. I found them, so now I have my second set as a back up!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: more muffle than block
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my expectations were too high, but these plugs did very little to block out the ambient conversations in my office. A little muffled, but still too loud for me. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: iHappy

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy bass
customer_reviews.text: These were my first earplugs I purchased and I really enjoyed them. Had them for over 2 years until I lost one of them at Lost Lands but they are GREAT for bass shows without cancelling out too much noise. They come with a string that you can attach at the ends of them but I never used it. The carrying case they come in is a perfect size! Highly recommend to anyone who attends heavy bass shows and festivals
customer_reviews.author: L96A

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for multiple festivals and shows now. I always bring them and don't go without now. Perfect. Might have to buy a second pair just to keep around. It doesn't like muffle the sound just drops the decimals and you still really enjoy the music.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a loud show, discreet enough that no one will notice
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I went to a show in a tiny venue that would otherwise blow out our hearing for days (if not for life!) These were extremely comfortable, super easy to put in and take out, and muted the sound really well without sacrificing sound quality at all. Exactly what we were looking for. They were also discreet enough that you can barely notice they're in! I paid full price for these suckers and they were worth every penny. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Work well but are not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use at concerts and festivals. Unfortunately they are a bit small for my big ears, making them uncomfortable. I also lost one from simply jumping around. I would not recommend if you have big ears or will be jumping a lot
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: the price is good for these
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's me but these do tend to cut out a little of the highs to the point where audio is not perfectly clear. But, they are very effective in blocking the loudness. Bought a second pair, the price is good for these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: complete Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: As a musician, I am bombarded by the sometimes harmful blaring of trumpets and trombones, and in addition to having a hearing deficiency in one of my ears, these ear plugs are my salvation. The have performed exactly the way I had expected. Plus this is my second pair that I have purchased. Very pleased. R. Pici
customer_reviews.author: Robert N. Pici

customer_reviews.title: ... those crazy rock and roll shows- kids dont generally like to wear ear protection because its not cool to ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy these for your kids that are going to those crazy rock and roll shows- kids dont generally like to wear ear protection because its not cool to have little orange nuggets poking out of your ears. Also, those little orange nuggets compromise sound quality. There earplugs are not noticeable and do not compromise sound quality. I love live music, I also love being able to hear the next day after a concert- These little guys do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: TINNITUS
customer_reviews.text: I frequently have ringing in my ears triggered by subtle continuous background noises (E.G. a fan running). These plugs block out the background that most folks would never notice, greatly reducing the problem.
customer_reviews.author: rh

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable and easy to put in and out and cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Went to a concert with my wife and these things made a world of difference. They are comfortable and easy to put in and out and cut down that loud music at the concert to a much more tolerable yet pretty clear sound still coming in. I would highly recommend if you want to save your hearing yet still enjoy some music. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Poor Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m interested in protecting my hearing and wore these to an outdoor concert last week. The sound was so muffled and muddy that I took them out. Perhaps they’d work better indoors when the music is way too loud, but I was really disappointed in the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: The Best at an affordable price range / perhaps the The Best period.
customer_reviews.text: My new go-to as a professional drummer. Definitely equalizes the frequencies around me so that I usually prefer to play with them in. They make your instrument sound great as well as everyone else’s. The carrying case is key so that you always have them on your keychain. They easily beat out the pricing of most competitors. My only complaint would be that perhaps they are a bit too large or stiff because I probably have slightly less than average ear canal size. This problem would likely only be fixed with custom ear plugs about 10x the price. But the slight ear fatigue is not that bad and they easily get me through a whole session or show.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Mester

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice for the ten bucks that I paid
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice for the ten bucks that I paid. Great way to just "lower the volume" at a concert without muffling it. It still makes your own voice sound different, which is a little weird when you sing along at a show or talk to other people, but I don't think there's really a way to avoid that. Works as advertised, so five stars...
customer_reviews.author: Nick Luchsinger

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone with sensitive hearing.
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased these for me because I frequently complain that music is too loud at concerts and plays. They are great. I have even used them at public meetings where I was sitting too close to the loudspeakers. I can understand every word, but don't get a headache anymore. The convenient carrying case means that they are always in my purse, ready to pull out as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mayhew

customer_reviews.title: OK but falls apart when using
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for light blocking of sound and it works well for that. The problem is, the post that you hold on to when putting in and taking out falls off the plug randomly, so it is a bit annoying for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: one fell off cord
customer_reviews.text: I wear these at auto races and keep the cord clipped to my shirt/top so I can access the plugs when needed, take out when I don't need them and have them handy. Looked down once to put them back in and one had come off and was lost. They do seem to be pretty tight and secure. Not sure how it happened but now, with only, one they're useless. Not saying it wasn't my fault but again, not sure how it could have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Caserta

customer_reviews.title: Prevent hearing loss at clubs and concerts
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for saving your ears when you're at a loud event. I used these earplugs at several clubs in Las Vegas where I was able to hear the music clearly and no one even noticed I was wearing them. They are also very light and comfortable. I forgot I was wearing them after some time. The soft carrying case is very convenient. It is easy to open and close and helped me keep track of the earplugs while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D.

customer_reviews.title: Reduce volume evenly over all frequences
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of these in blue already and I got these for my husband. I keep both sets in my purse and we use them in loud places, like restaurants or concerts, to avoid headaches and protect our hearing. They mostly do not distort the sound quality, just reduce the volume. Keep in mind that all "internal" sounds will seem amplified and be pretty annoying (such as chewing, hearing yourself talk, etc). This is normal for earplugs and not a fault of these in particular, but something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: They Just Lie About the Rating
customer_reviews.text: The actual rating is 12 I believe. The official rating on the back says so, despite the advertising of it being for 20 decibels. When I actually tried them, even putting my fingers in my ears was more effective. Even if that was all the protection you needed, I would say give your money to someone who isn't trying to deceive you. I might add a photo if I can get back to the person who I gifted them to.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: She uses these at school and has been doing better - reports she is much less distracted by the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Autistic child - works very well to dampen noises that she is sensitive to. She uses these at school and has been doing better - reports she is much less distracted by the sounds people make around her. I will be purchasing another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie L

customer_reviews.title: Great for Concerts
customer_reviews.text: Wore them to a Jack U and a Skrillex concert separately. Works great to keep the louder sounds down without diminishing the concert experience. I was worried about them falling out because I sweat a lot, but they stayed in really well and I was able to take them out/ put them in whenever I needed and they didn't slip out. They also come in a convenient case so you don't lose them after you take them out which was great.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Stop permanently ruining your hearing and buy these.
customer_reviews.text: After getting sick of damaging my hearing, finally decided to purchase some ear-plugs. Sat front row at a concert in front of a pair of speakers.... was able to hear everything clearly and had a blast. Afterward, I took these out and I had absolutely no after-effects of sitting in front of a speaker. No muffled hearing, no ringing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Not for me :-(
customer_reviews.text: I have many different earplugs got these but unfortunately the tips are um, Sandpaper or at least that is what they feel like. All my other earplugs are nice and smooth all in ear headphones nice and smooth for some reason the material on these feels very rough. In the hand i can feel it and in the ear yes sandpaper is the first thing that comes to mind. I suppose these probably work for some people and that's great. Just be aware might not be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Pharris

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I like the ear plugs but as a word of wisdom, get the large size. The regular are extremely small and don't seal up well. The regular size might work well for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Deandre

customer_reviews.title: gorgeous, comfortable ear protection at concerts
customer_reviews.text: so smooth you don't even notice their in! And the uniform music attenuation, literally is just like someone pressed the "decrease volume" button it is magical, in my opinion :)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Reina

customer_reviews.title: These are very hard and stiff.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this brand of earplugs to wear in the gym. I have two other sets of earplugs from different brands that are way more comfortable. These were too hard and stiff for my liking. I bought the standard size which did not fit right at all because they were not in any way flexible or pliable. I should have returned them but I didn't. I can't wear them. I won't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Lighworker_Soul

customer_reviews.title: A must to protect your hearing
customer_reviews.text: These are the best plugs.. My husband uses them all the time. His hearing is already damaged from working construction and loud music so these are a must.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Nice earplugs. Recommended for concerts
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice earplugs. I bought these for my son, who wanted some earplugs before attending some concerts (smart move). He appreciated not having his ears ringing after sitting close to the front of the stage at the concert. I would recommend these earplugs to anyone wanting to protect their hearing when attending concerts or other events where continuously high volumes could damage your hearing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nevarez

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pair of earplugs to wear when live music gets loud without ruining the experience like foam earplugs do. These seem to do the job well. Easy to clean, comfortable to wear and decent sound. It doesn't sound as good as it does without earplugs but it sounds a whole lot better than ringing ears afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah B.

customer_reviews.title: This plugs are excellent, they turn the volume down just enough so ...
customer_reviews.text: This plugs are excellent, they turn the volume down just enough so you can enjoy live music without loosing your hearing. **Update** So far I've used them at concerts in small venues and for watching band practicesand they're very good, they tone down the volume without loosing quality, I have also used them on company meetings because my boss it's too loud and it works great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mar****

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The only (big) complaint I have is that you have to jam these things DEEP to work. Too deep... I’m looking for replacements now.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Kim

customer_reviews.title: Helpful earplugs for concerts
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of using foam earplugs for concerts. Bought the Etyplugs and another brand at similar price. The Etyplugs fit into the ears nicely and were easy to remove. They came with a little plastic case and a cord to attach to the plugs. Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Wright

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE THE PLUGS TO BUY! I've tried Dubs, Hear-os, all types of regular squishy earplugs, but these are the BEST. They cut just the right amount of sound out with muffling things. For Musicians, these are the ONLY earplugs I'll wear onstage. They stay in well (even during fierce headbanging), and dont muffle the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: After a year testing out other earplugs...
customer_reviews.text: -Only good for 2-3 months of active use -cheap, so getting new plugs is not eating your wallet -comfortable -blocks loud DB -great for bass guitar players -Each package contains the plugs, protective casing and braided string to attach the ear plugs These plugs are possibly the best set so far, took me a year. Some people may not enjoy them if they have small ear canals. So make sure you know your size.
customer_reviews.author: Miolinkko

customer_reviews.title: Work very well. No brainer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly impressed with how well these worked. I was able to stand front row at an electronic / EDM show, complete with blown out volume and bass, and could comfortably hear the entire range of music (probably better than everyone around me. The best way to describe the experience is they "take the edge" off of the sound without losing any part of it. They're also super discrete, as the clear tubes barely stick out of your ears. No one realized I had them in, which was a point I was initially self conscious on. For the price, these are a no brainer!
customer_reviews.author: JP Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great for muffling loud/live music in a small setting
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for me. It muffled the loud sound of the live band in a small room, yet allowed me to hear the music and allowed me to here the people around me when they were speaking. I usually have a very tough time hearing any thing any one says when I'm in this setting but these definitely did the trick! The only thing I found difficult was judging how loudly I was speaking.
customer_reviews.author: KSH

customer_reviews.title: Great results for the price range.
customer_reviews.text: Minimal protection for loud things like engines, vacuums, and concerts. It will be quite uncomfortable after an hour if you aren't used to it, and even though you can generally hear the sounds of anything you might be interested in hearing, it's still a bit muffled. I'm thinking the fancy version of these are probably magical.
customer_reviews.author: PartisanGerm

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Sound Filtering
customer_reviews.text: Terrible sound filtering and they almost seem to amplify certain tones which both my wife and I agreed upon individually and found bizarre.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Costa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the left ear, uncomfortable in the right
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if these plugs aren't the same shape or if it's my ear canals. Fits beautifully in the left; less so in right, and I've only worn them a few times so don't know if it's one weird plug one weird ear. While both are in place, I can still hear but loud noise is much quieter. I've with them on the train and been uncomfortable after about an hour. Since these stick out, you can't sleep in them. I would not rebuy.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kejabana

customer_reviews.title: Not so good.
customer_reviews.text: They don’t cancel much noise. On the plus side, there were 2 sets in the package—with one carrier. They are washable.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I could still hear everything just fine
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that they didn't soften the sound enough. I feel like I could still hear everything just fine. At the end of the concert my ears were not ringing at all, so I'm very happy with them. They come with a cord and a case.
customer_reviews.author: harbinjer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish And Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Classy and easy to hide, these are great for working with tools or enjoying a concert without damaging your ears. After several events that were marred by ringing ears, I'm glad I made the investment. Totally worth it! They also come with a convenient, discreet tough plastic case!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good plugs, varying quality
customer_reviews.text: They fell apart after the first use, I have had etymotic plugs in the past that lasted 6 months. But something must have changed in their manufacturing prosses because this time they were complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Little F.

customer_reviews.title: These do the perfect job! I feel like nothing is lost and ...
customer_reviews.text: As someone who goes to several concerts a month for the past 10 years of my life, I have been worried about my hearing. I was afraid to get earplugs in fear of not being able to hear the music as clearly. These do the perfect job! I feel like nothing is lost and they don't compromise any sound or enjoyment from concerts.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: They are amazing at reducing the large bass and sound of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have three pairs of these and I wish I had discovered them sooner. I will never attend a concert without these. They are amazing at reducing the large bass and sound of the music while still allowing quality hearing. You must protect your hearing and these do that and more.
customer_reviews.author: Manley

customer_reviews.title: Protect your ears!
customer_reviews.text: Playing in a band and trying to protect your ears is a tough job. I had tried another brand of earplugs and was unimpressed. They filtered way too much low end and didn't give an accurate sound. These ETY-Plugs are much better. The sound isn't perfect, but it is very good at lowering the volume while keeping a fairly accurate sound. I've used them both on stage with my band and at other bands' shows and been happy with the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Barak

customer_reviews.title: very minimal benefit, if any
customer_reviews.text: Almost unnoticeable difference with these. Additionally, the description clearly indicates a 20db reduction but the package received clearly indicates only 12 db.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Concert was amazing
customer_reviews.text: Went to see MONO in a small, loud room and I didn't feel like my experience was being hampered by these ear plugs. I could hear great! I took them out for some of the quieter sections but was able to slip them back in with as when it got loud again.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: These are really nice and worked very well at a loud ACDC concert ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice and worked very well at a loud ACDC concert that we went too. They can be placed as far in as you need them, depending on the occasion. We could hear the music and our ears did not ring for days afterwards. These are unique in the way that they remove the harshness of the loud squeals yet do not block the actual music and conversation. However, if they are pushed in all the way, they can also completely block out any noise!
customer_reviews.author: SavyThinker

customer_reviews.title: Barely any noise protection.
customer_reviews.text: I will give credit to these earplugs that they do provide crystal clear sound. You can barely tell the difference in sound quality between when you're wearing them vs when you pull them out. Unfortunately, they provide almost no protection. I could hear a slight volume difference between when I had them in vs when I pulled them out but it was very slight. I tried seating them differently and pushing them in more (ouch) and nothing helped. I left the concert with ringing ears. If they had a 40DB model I might try that but either 20DB isn't much protection or these aren't providing that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are perfect for concerts. The take down the decibels just the right amount where you can't really tell they're in but still can hear the music. There nothing like the ear plugs you use for sleeping as you can still talk to the person beside you if needed. I've worn them about 10 times now and my only regret is not buying them 10 years ago. I actually thought I lost them in the show once and had my flashlight out looking for them but realized they were still in my ears. For the price, it's a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Duberstein

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I wore these to an EDM concert in a nightclub. These earplugs are good at reducing volume to a comfortable level, but they aren't very good at retaining sound quality - they noticeably muffled higher frequencies, which detracted from the listening experience. These are the first earplugs I've ever bought so I'm not sure if this is the norm among all brands. I would recommend researching other pairs before making a final purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small, was unusable for me
customer_reviews.text: They didn't fit my ear. And I bought them months before I used them so I didn't bother sending them back. I consider my ear normal sized, the plug was way too small and has 0 function. I just used the ol foam plugs to attend a concert.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive ears have relief!
customer_reviews.text: These really do the job. My daughter with sensitive hearing uses one of these daily in her left ear while practicing her violin. She likes how they attenuate the shrill overtones without dampening her overall perception of pitch and timbre. Now she wants a pair for noisy restaurants. Seems like a good idea to me. I don’t know if they would work in that circumstance, but worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good
customer_reviews.text: I play bass in a band with 2 guitars, drum and keys and these work fine for me most of the time. Cuts the highs more than the lows, which is good for monitoring my instrument. Nevertheless, when compared to disposable foam plugs, things sound much closer to natural. Considering the fact that the price point is comparable to that of a a pack of disposable earplugs, these sound amazing. But if you are in a really really loud band, you might need something with more noise reduction.
customer_reviews.author: emeron

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like muffled and muddy sound
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs were not comfortable at all. They also muffle the sound of a concert way to much. I couldn’t understand the words that were sung. It sounded like I was underwater until I took them out. I listened to an opener band with these in, but had to take them out to hear the main event. I would not recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a concert
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs are simply amazing! Wearing them allows you to still be able to hear the music and not have the terrible ringing in your ears the next day. I would definitely recommend them if you are going to be in a loud club or concert. To me it was basically like lowering the volume without distorting the sound like many other ear plugs I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: James McChristy

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: These are great earplugs! I wear them while in the club; very comfortable and very low profile.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Bad construction.
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous version of this product and I liked them but lost them! So I ordered a new set. Unfortunately the new set fell apart immediately and is far poorer made. Rip off at this point. Don’t buy from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: Wish I bought these sooner, got a real scare after clubbing one night and my ears rang for 3 days. Bought these, work like a charm, it feels like the music is just turned down a little bit. Quality is still perfect! (:
customer_reviews.author: timothy nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Worked fantastic, lowered the volume without distorting the sound
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic, lowered the volume without distorting the sound. My only complaint is how far they stick out of my ears. I was a little worried at a metal show that I might get 1 pushed in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid protection with good fit for teens/women.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used these at a hard rock festival when close to the stage and was able to enjoy the music without noticeable muffling, and without her ears ringing after the day-long festival. They come in a reusable plastic pack with a connecting string so you can keep them around your neck between numbers. She had a little trouble at first fitting them into her ear, but it only took a couple of tries, and the flanges made it an easier fit for a female/teen ear.
customer_reviews.author: rigger

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't really tell much of a difference...
customer_reviews.text: I got these to help with the deep bass that rattles my ears at concerts. I honestly couldn't really tell that much of a difference in the sound, but they didn't keep the bass from hurting my ears. Perhaps that shouldn't have been my expectation, but it doesn't really say what the expected result should be. I'll likely just stick with normal earplugs hanging halfway out of my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L

customer_reviews.title: False Advertised the db cancellation
customer_reviews.text: The description on Amazon says that they cancel 20 dbs of sound, however the package when I got it says it only cancels twelve. Its not a big deal to me whether its 12 or 20 but I would just like the description to match what he product actually is so I know I'm paying for what I get. If you specifically need 20 dbs I would recommend another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Suzetta

customer_reviews.title: Essential for protecting your hearing.
customer_reviews.text: If you work live events or in loud environments, these are essential to protect your hearing. Regular disposable ear buds can protect your hearing but they can muffle the actual sound which can get in the way of monitoring quality. These are closer to "turning the volume down" rather than "muffling the volume down".
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same pair of these for 4 years now and I bought my current ones to replace an old pair that I lost at a foam party. These are my favorite ear plugs. I love hearing live music in these because they only dampen the sounds (mostly highs and mids which in live settings are usually too loud for my ears) and I can still hold a conversation with people around me. I accidentally left them in my pants and put them through the wash and now they are good as new!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole c

customer_reviews.title: I love these. I work at a nightclub & they're ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these . I work at a nightclub & they're a lifesaver when snoop or lady Gaga or Rolling Stones are playing . It gets loud! What?
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: price is great! My husband who is a huge concert goer ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these based on reviews, price is great! My husband who is a huge concert goer really liked them, states they help with the noise level but don’t shut it out which is perfect. I bought a set for each of us, worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: rorangel13

customer_reviews.title: Use them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for Warped Tour. Forgot them. I get close to the stages. Have tinnitus now. I use them to my other concerts so it doesn't get worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good high fidelity ear plugs
customer_reviews.text: This pair was a little smaller than the last pair of these I got. Kinda felt like it left room for the loudness to make it in. But these are great earplugs. They were recommended to me by a professional drummer friend and are what I use when I attend concerts. Kinda wish this particular pair were a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: KattyPants

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: They don't reduce sound quality, just make everything a little quieter. I wear them for metal concerts. I have developed tinnitus in the last few months but I'm pretty sure it's from TMJ not from actual ear damage because my ears never ring after concerts where I wear these. The one downside is that if you produce a lot of ear wax these can be hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Essential bar hopping hearing protection
customer_reviews.text: The ER-20s come in two sizes: normal (blue) and large (white). I was using the white ones, but found that the blues fit my ears better. The ER-20s are the only ear protection that allows me to hear what people are saying without being blasted by background "thump thump" bar music. They are easy to wear, easy to clean, and unobtrusive with their their clear plastic stems. No, they don't truly attenuate all frequencies by equal DBs, but they are so superior to cheap foam plugs in that regard there's no comparison whatsoever. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeAmazon

product_meta.title: Etymotic Research ER20 High-Fidelity Earplugs (Concerts, Musicians, Airplanes, Motorcycles, Sensitivity and Universal Hearing Protection) - Standard, Clear Stem w/ Frost Tip
product_meta.description: Hearing loss from loud sound affects millions of people, but noise-induced hearing loss is preventable! ETY-Plugs are the world’s first ready-fit, high-fidelity earplugs that reduce sound levels evenly while preserving sound quality and clarity. ETY Plugs replicate the natural response of the ear, so sound quality is the same as the original, only quieter. Music and voices are clear--not muffled--making ETY Plugs ideal for concerts, clubs, theaters, aircraft, construction, yard work, airshows, parades, and athletic or motorsports events. The standard size fits the majority of ears. ETY Plugs are reusable, but with repeated use, the eartips may lose elasticity. For best performance and retention, if you use your ETY Plugs frequently, replace them every 3-6 months. ETY-Plugs are not recommended for use with impulse noises such as gunfire, or for sleeping or swimming.
feature_bullets: Includes: 1 pair standard fit ETY Plugs with frost tips, neck cord, and carrying case
Replicates the natural response of the ear, so sound quality is the same as the original, only quieter. Music and speech are clear, not muffled.
Reduces risk of hearing damage from loud noise such as concerts, theatres, airshows, parades, athletic and motorsports events.
Enhances the music experience; Allows musicians to hear their own instrument and their blend with others.
Not recommended for use with impulse noise, e.g., shooting sports. Not recommended for sleeping.
Reduces noise while preserving sound quality
Note: The Baby Blues are for smaller ear canals
All sound is reduced evenly by 20 dB
Reduces noise while preserving sound quality
Note: The Baby Blues are for smaller ear canals
All sound is reduced evenly by 20 dB
